*About Access Now*Access Now is a growing international human rights organization dedicated to defending and extending the digital rights of users at risk around the world, including issues of privacy, security, freedom of expression, and transparency. *About this role*The Humanitarian Officer leads the organization’s policy positioning and advocacy with multilateral organizations and international partners engaged in governance of information and communications technologies in humanitarian response, peace and security interventions, and related activities.
The Humanitarian Officer supports the mission and goals of Access Now by assisting in our growing work extending and defending the digital rights of people and communities in crisis, especially those in fragile and conflict-affected states, through engagement in advocacy and policy reform at the responsible agencies and authorities. The Officer uses international humanitarian law (IHL) and the law of armed conflict to complement our human rights-based approach to advancing human security, to achieve our mission.
The Humanitarian Officer works through the Advocacy Arm, within the International Organizations section of the Policy and International Programs team, in close coordination with the Legal Programmatic and Campaigns and Rapid Response teams in particular. Track tech sector activities impacting humanitarian situations, and develop and implement advocacy strategies ensuring human rights accountability in public -private partnerships and relevant private sector initiatives
Work closely with our regional teams and rapid response coordinators, monitors the digital rights situation in fragile and conflict-affected states and communities, and develops and implements advocacy strategies to prevent, mitigate, and remedy ICT-related harms through multilateral engagement

Perform other duties as assigned
